intro: Siphocampylus pinnatisectus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved siphocampylus, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its distinctive, finely divided foliage. It features a basal rosette of leaves that are pinnatisect, meaning they are deeply divided into narrow, elongated segments. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile, and thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in specialty gardens.
